reviewText: "Lock, Stock, and Barrel" shows how large buildings were  moved in the late 1800s and early 1900s, and takes viewers along while two are moved in "real time" - an general store stocked with antiques, and a funeral home stocked with equipment and furniture.  Prior moves include a hotel for 5,000-some guests, put up on 112 railroad cars and hitched to three steam engines for a 3-day 555' pull, and an 8-story Indianapolis office moved while 600 workers continued to work, with gas and electric connected.
